fr.sii.ogham.sms.builder.cloudhopper

Class EncoderBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.AbstractParent<CloudhopperBuilder>
      • fr.sii.ogham.sms.builder.cloudhopper.EncoderBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<Encoder>, Parent<CloudhopperBuilder>

    public class EncoderBuilder
extends AbstractParent<CloudhopperBuilder>
implements Builder<Encoder>
    Configures text message encoding: It supports GSM 03.38 standard encodings. It automatically guess the best supported encoding in order to use the minimum octets:
    • It encodes using GSM 7-bit default alphabet if the message contains only characters defined in the table. Message is packed so the message can have a maximum length of 160 characters. This is enable only if automatic guessing is enabled (using autoGuess(boolean) or autoGuess(String...)) and GSM 7-bit is enabled (using gsm7bitPacked(int), gsm7bitPacked(String...) or gsm7bitPacked(int, boolean)).
    • It encodes using GSM 8-bit data encoding if the message contains only characters that can be encoded on one octet. This is enable only if automatic guessing is enabled (using autoGuess(boolean) or autoGuess(String...)) and GSM 8-bit is enabled (using gsm8bit(int), gsm8bit(String...) or gsm8bit(int, boolean)).
    • It encodes using Latin 1 (ISO-8859-1) data encoding if the message contains only characters that can be encoded on one octet. This is enable only if automatic guessing is enabled (using autoGuess(boolean) or autoGuess(String...)) and GSM 8-bit is enabled (using latin1(int), latin1(String...) or latin1(int, boolean)).
    • It encodes using UCS-2 encoding if the message contains special characters that can't be encoded on one octet. Each character is encoded on two octets. This is enable only if automatic guessing is enabled (using autoGuess(boolean) or autoGuess(String...)) and UCS-2 is enabled (using ucs2(int), ucs2(String...) or ucs2(int, boolean)).

    Automatic guessing enabled

    Standard encodings are registered with a priority. The priority is used when auto-guessing is enabled. Each registered encoding is tested against the text message starting with the encoding with the highest priority.

    If a priority is set to 0 (or negative number), the encoding is disabled.

    Any registered custom encoder is added into the guessing list according to its priority. Use a the highest value to use custom encoder first. To know default priority values for encodings, see DefaultCloudhopperConfigurer.

    Automatic guessing disabled

    Standard encodings are not registered at all.

    If custom encoders are registered then only those encoders are used.

    If no custom encoders are registered, then default charset encoding is used (see fallback(String...)).

    Author:
    Aurélien Baudet

      • EncoderBuilder

        public EncoderBuilder(CloudhopperBuilder parent,
                      EnvironmentBuilder<?> environmentBuilder)
        Initializes the builder with a parent builder. The parent builder is used when calling AbstractParent.and() method. The EnvironmentBuilder is used to evaluate properties when build() method is called.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent builder
        environmentBuilder - the configuration for property resolution and evaluation

    • Method Detail

      • gsm7bitPacked

        public EncoderBuilder gsm7bitPacked(int priority)
        Set priority for encoding text messages using GSM 7-bit encoding. GSM 7-bit encoding and GSM 8-bit encoding use the same character tables. Only 7 bits are necessary to represents characters. In GSM 8-bit encoding a leading 0 is added. However, GSM 7-bit encoding is packed. Every character is "merged" with the next one in order to use more characters for the same number of octets.

        If several properties are already set using gsm7bitPacked(String...), then the priority value is appended (low priority). For example, 

          
 .gsm7bitPacked("${custom.property.high-priority}")
 .gsm7bitPacked(1000)
        If "custom.property.high-priority" property doesn't exist, then .gsm7bitPacked(1000) is used. If "custom.property.high-priority" property exists, then the value of "custom.property.high-priority" is used. 
          
 .gsm7bitPacked(1000)
 .gsm7bitPacked("${custom.property.high-priority}")
        The value of .gsm7bitPacked(1000) is always used.
        Parameters:
        priority - the priority for GSM 7-bit encoding
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • gsm7bitPacked

        public EncoderBuilder gsm7bitPacked(int priority,
                                    boolean override)
        Set priority for encoding text messages using GSM 7-bit encoding. GSM 7-bit encoding and GSM 8-bit encoding use the same character tables. Only 7 bits are necessary to represents characters. In GSM 8-bit encoding a leading 0 is added. However, GSM 7-bit encoding is packed. Every character is "merged" with the next one in order to use more characters for the same number of octets.

        If priority value is 0 (or negative number), the GSM 7-bit encoding is disabled.

        If several properties are already set using gsm7bitPacked(String...) and override parameter is true, the priority value is added first (highest priority). For example, 

          
 .gsm7bitPacked("${custom.property.high-priority}")
 .gsm7bitPacked(1000, true)
        The value of .gsm7bitPacked(1000, true) is always used.

        If override parameter is false, this method behaves exactly the same as gsm7bitPacked(int).

        Parameters:
        priority - the priority for GSM 7-bit encoding
        override - if true the priority value is added at the beginning, if false the priority value is added at the end
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • gsm7bitPacked

        public EncoderBuilder gsm7bitPacked(String... priority)
        Set priority for encoding text messages using GSM 7-bit encoding. GSM 7-bit encoding and GSM 8-bit encoding use the same character tables. Only 7 bits are necessary to represents characters. In GSM 8-bit encoding a leading 0 is added. However, GSM 7-bit encoding is packed. Every character is "merged" with the next one in order to use more characters for the same number of octets.

        You can specify a direct value. For example: 

         .gsm8bit("1000");

        You can also specify one or several property keys. For example: 

         .gsm8bit("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}");
        The properties are not immediately evaluated. The evaluation will be done when the build() method is called. If you provide several property keys, evaluation will be done on the first key and if the property exists (see EnvironmentBuilder), its value is used. If the first property doesn't exist in properties, then it tries with the second one and so on.
        Parameters:
        priority - one value, or one or several property keys
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • gsm8bit

        public EncoderBuilder gsm8bit(int priority)
        Set priority for encoding text messages using GSM 8-bit encoding. GSM 7-bit encoding and GSM 8-bit encoding use the same character tables. Only 7 bits are necessary to represents characters. In GSM 8-bit encoding a leading 0 is added.

        If several properties are already set using gsm8bit(String...), then the priority value is appended (low priority). For example, 

          
 .gsm8bit("${custom.property.high-priority}")
 .gsm8bit(1000)
        If "custom.property.high-priority" property doesn't exist, then .gsm8bit(1000) is used. If "custom.property.high-priority" property exists, then the value of "custom.property.high-priority" is used. 
          
 .gsm8bit(1000)
 .gsm8bit("${custom.property.high-priority}")
        The value of .gsm8bit(1000) is always used.
        Parameters:
        priority - the priority for GSM 8-bit encoding
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

        If priority value is 0 (or negative number), the GSM 8-bit encoding is disabled.

        If several properties are already set using gsm8bit(String...) and override parameter is true, the priority value is added first (highest priority). For example,

 .gsm8bit(1000, true)
        The value of .gsm8bit(1000, true) is always used.

        If override parameter is false, this method behaves exactly the same as gsm8bit(int).

        Parameters:
        priority - the priority for GSM 8-bit encoding
        override - if true the priority value is added at the beginning, if false the priority value is added at the end
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

If the first property doesn't exist in properties, then it tries with the second one and so on.

      • ucs2

        public EncoderBuilder ucs2(int priority)
        Set priority for encoding text messages using UCS-2. UCS-2 uses two octets per character.

        If several properties are already set using ucs2(String...), then the priority value is appended (low priority). For example, 

          
 .ucs2("${custom.property.high-priority}")
 .ucs2(1000)
        If "custom.property.high-priority" property doesn't exist, then .ucs2(1000) is used. If "custom.property.high-priority" property exists, then the value of "custom.property.high-priority" is used. 
          
 .ucs2(1000)
 .ucs2("${custom.property.high-priority}")
        The value of .ucs2(1000) is always used.
        Parameters:
        priority - the priority for UCS-2 encoding
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • ucs2

        public EncoderBuilder ucs2(int priority,
                           boolean override)
        Set priority for encoding text messages using UCS-2. UCS-2 uses two octets per character.

        If priority value is 0 (or negative number), the UCS-2 is disabled.

        If several properties are already set using ucs2(String...) and override parameter is true, the priority value is added first (highest priority). For example, 

          
 .ucs2("${custom.property.high-priority}")
 .ucs2(1000, true)
        The value of .ucs2(1000, true) is always used.

        If override parameter is false, this method behaves exactly the same as ucs2(int).

        Parameters:
        priority - the priority for UCS-2 encoding
        override - if true the priority value is added at the beginning, if false the priority value is added at the end
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • ucs2

        public EncoderBuilder ucs2(String... priority)
        Set priority for encoding text messages using UCS-2. UCS-2 uses two octets per character. You can specify a direct value. For example: 
         .ucs2("1000");

        You can also specify one or several property keys. For example: 

         .ucs2("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}");
        The properties are not immediately evaluated. The evaluation will be done when the build() method is called. If you provide several property keys, evaluation will be done on the first key and if the property exists (see EnvironmentBuilder), its value is used. If the first property doesn't exist in properties, then it tries with the second one and so on.
        Parameters:
        priority - one value, or one or several property keys
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

If you provide several property keys, evaluation will be done on the first key and if the property exists (see EnvironmentBuilder), its value is used. If the first property doesn't exist in properties, then it tries with the second one and so on.

      • latin1

        public EncoderBuilder latin1(int priority,
                             boolean override)
        Set priority for encoding text messages using Latin 1 (ISO-8859-1).

        If priority value is 0 (or negative number), the Latin 1 (ISO-8859-1) is disabled.

        If several properties are already set using latin1(String...) and override parameter is true, the priority value is added first (highest priority). For example, 

          
 .latin1("${custom.property.high-priority}")
 .latin1(1000, true)
        The value of .latin1(1000, true) is always used.

        If override parameter is false, this method behaves exactly the same as latin1(int).

        Parameters:

        override - if true the priority value is added at the beginning, if false the priority value is added at the end
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • register

        public EncoderBuilder register(Encoder encoder,
                               int priority)
        Register a custom Encoder with associated priority.

        The encoder is registered like standard encoders (see gsm7bitPacked(String...), gsm8bit(String...), latin1(String...), ucs2(String...)).

        If automatic guessing is enabled (see autoGuess(String...)), the registered encoder is also used in automatic guessing (according to priorities).

        If automatic guessing is disabled, only custom Encoder(s) that are registered using this method are used. They are executed according to priority order (highest priority is executed first). If encoder fails to encode (throws EncodingException) then the next one is tried. The registered encoder can also implement SupportingEncoder interface to indicate if the encoder is able to encode or not the text.

        If priority is set to 0 (or negative number), the associated encoder is disabled.

        Parameters:
        encoder - the encoder to register
        priority - the associated priority (the highest priority is executed first)
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • autoGuess

        public EncoderBuilder autoGuess(boolean enable)
        Enable/disable automatic guessing of message encoding.

        If enables, it automatically guess the best supported encoding in order to use the minimum octets:

        • It encodes using GSM 7-bit default alphabet if the message contains only characters defined in the table. Message is packed so the message can have a maximum length of 160 characters. This is enable only if automatic guessing is enabled (using autoGuess(boolean) or autoGuess(String...)) and GSM 7-bit is enabled (using gsm7bitPacked(int), gsm7bitPacked(String...) or gsm7bitPacked(int, boolean)).
        • It encodes using GSM 8-bit data encoding if the message contains only characters that can be encoded on one octet. This is enable only if automatic guessing is enabled (using autoGuess(boolean) or autoGuess(String...)) and GSM 8-bit is enabled (using gsm8bit(int), gsm8bit(String...) or gsm8bit(int, boolean)).
        • It encodes using Latin 1 (ISO-8859-1) data encoding if the message contains only characters that can be encoded on one octet. This is enable only if automatic guessing is enabled (using autoGuess(boolean) or autoGuess(String...)) and GSM 8-bit is enabled (using latin1(int), latin1(String...) or latin1(int, boolean)).
        • It encodes using UCS-2 encoding if the message contains special characters that can't be encoded on one octet. Each character is encoded on two octets. This is enable only if automatic guessing is enabled (using autoGuess(boolean) or autoGuess(String...)) and UCS-2 is enabled (using ucs2(int), ucs2(String...) or ucs2(int, boolean)).

        If several properties are already set using autoGuess(String...), then the enabled value is appended (low priority). For example, 

          
 .autoGuess("${custom.property.high-priority}")
 .autoGuess(true)
        If "custom.property.high-priority" property doesn't exist, then .autoGuess(true) is used. If "custom.property.high-priority" property exists, then the value of "custom.property.high-priority" is used. 
          
 .autoGuess(true)
 .autoGuess("${custom.property.high-priority}")
        The value of .autoGuess(true) is always used.
        Parameters:
        enable - enable (true) or disable (false) automatic encoding guessing
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • autoGuess

        public EncoderBuilder autoGuess(String... enable)
        Enable/disable automatic guessing of message encoding.

        If enables, it automatically guess the best supported encoding in order to use the minimum octets:

        • It encodes using GSM 7-bit default alphabet if the message contains only characters defined in the table. Message is packed so the message can have a maximum length of 160 characters. This is enable only if automatic guessing is enabled (using autoGuess(boolean) or autoGuess(String...)) and GSM 7-bit is enabled (using gsm7bitPacked(int), gsm7bitPacked(String...) or gsm7bitPacked(int, boolean)).
        • It encodes using GSM 8-bit data encoding if the message contains only characters that can be encoded on one octet. This is enable only if automatic guessing is enabled (using autoGuess(boolean) or autoGuess(String...)) and GSM 8-bit is enabled (using gsm8bit(int), gsm8bit(String...) or gsm8bit(int, boolean)).
        • It encodes using Latin 1 (ISO-8859-1) data encoding if the message contains only characters that can be encoded on one octet. This is enable only if automatic guessing is enabled (using autoGuess(boolean) or autoGuess(String...)) and GSM 8-bit is enabled (using latin1(int), latin1(String...) or latin1(int, boolean)).
        • It encodes using UCS-2 encoding if the message contains special characters that can't be encoded on one octet. Each character is encoded on two octets. This is enable only if automatic guessing is enabled (using autoGuess(boolean) or autoGuess(String...)) and UCS-2 is enabled (using ucs2(int), ucs2(String...) or ucs2(int, boolean)).
        You can specify a direct value. For example: 
         .autoGuess("true");

        You can also specify one or several property keys. For example: 

         .autoGuess("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}");
        The properties are not immediately evaluated. The evaluation will be done when the build() method is called. If you provide several property keys, evaluation will be done on the first key and if the property exists (see EnvironmentBuilder), its value is used. If the first property doesn't exist in properties, then it tries with the second one and so on.
        Parameters:
        enable - one value, or one or several property keys
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • fallback

        public EncoderBuilder fallback(String... charsetName)
        Set which Cloudhopper Charset should be used if nothing else is configured. You can specify a direct value. For example: 
         .fallback("GSM");

        You can also specify one or several property keys. For example: 

         .fallback("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}");
        The properties are not immediately evaluated. The evaluation will be done when the build() method is called. If you provide several property keys, evaluation will be done on the first key and if the property exists (see EnvironmentBuilder), its value is used. If the first property doesn't exist in properties, then it tries with the second one and so on.
        Parameters:
        charsetName - one value, or one or several property keys
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining
